message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.HC, cs.SY

This paper deals with the security of air-gapped computers and proposes a new method for leaking data from such systems. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves the implementation of a malware prototype, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.SE (Software Engineering). The paper discusses the technical background and characteristics of magnetic fields, which could place it in cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also mentions the use of virtual machines, which could suggest it belongs to cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction). Finally, the paper deals with the security of isolated systems, which could place it in cs.SY (Systems and Control).
